description: A Sat Yogi is one who has renounced the habit of unhappiness.Have you renounced that bad habit?That bad habit is also known as the ego. The ego is a state of perpetual dissatisfaction because the ego is dissatisfied with itself. And, of course, it projects its shadow out as its world, and becomes unhappy with its world, with its situation. But it knows that no matter how it changes the situation, it will remain unhappy…

title: Into the Ultimate Mystery…
description: May we have the intelligence to say “yes” to what is being offered, and take the journey into the Ultimate Mystery to discover who we are, and of what we are capable of dreaming into manifestation…

title: The Ego’s Mortal Enemy
description: This Supreme Intelligence, has imagined archetypal forms of beauty; of carriers of this Intelligence, into a world of infinite possibility; of the application of creative intelligence, in a context of multiplicity. But that multiplicity is a union, because all beings are linked by and within the matrix of this Supreme Intelligence….

title: The Struggle of Freedom and Fear
description: In the statue of Nataraj, one leg is on the dwarf, and one is raised. The foot that’s on the dwarf, teaches us about the heaviness of karma, when we are resistant to the presence of God or in the illusion of a separate existence. Then we will feel the resistance of the material world that we have mistakenly conjured up into being, that will resist us, and our intentions, or bring them a futility, to a point of diminishing returns, to the recognition of the vanity of the human being, and its ultimate meaninglessness, when it attempts to exist separate from its own Source, its own intelligence, its own reality…

title: The Key to Liberation: Coherence
description: The key to liberation is coherence. If you take an ordinary light bulb, its rays will shine in all directions, incoherently. That incoherence has a value—you get to see the whole room. But you don’t get to break through the space of that room, as you would if you were able to make all of those light rays coherent, and turn the beam into a laser. And if you had a powerful enough laser beam you could burn and hole in the wall and get out of the room. Lasers create coherent light. Meditation creates a coherent mind….

title: The Power of Freedom Lies in Claiming It Now
description: The same blissful Self resides in every physical organism here, and resides transcendent of all, and containing all of this, and produces this electromagnetic field, in which we all share a unified energy. Can you feel this boundary-less, boundless, unified wholeness, that we constitute as an apparent many-ness, that has discovered its Oneness?

title: The Essential Function of an Avatar
description: A Sat Yogi is one who realizes being an avatar of that Supreme Essence. And because you are a manifestation of that Supreme Intelligence, that transcends time and space, the Self that you are is untouched by events that occur in spacetime, in the waking dream. Because you are the Dreamer of this bardo of the dream, of the cosmos, you cannot be afflicted by any of its conflicting events…

title: The Cosmic Kumbhaka
description: The universe breathes itself towards its own final cosmic kumbhaka, in which all change stops even at the circumference. And the center emerges from nowhere to everywhere, and reveals that infinite potential, to be present even in the midst of hopelessness and darkness and deadlock and destruction, until it is clear to every living point of consciousness, that the One Self that has breathed life into it, is eternal, and victorious in such a way that cannot be pre-judged by any mind…

title: The Real Self is Pure Paradox
description: From the perspective of human logic and language, the Self is total paradox. And once the Self is realized, then everything is realized as being paradoxical. But the Self is the source of paradox and the reason why paradox rules over Aristotelian logic, and, therefore, why anything is possible…

title: Churn the Ocean of Consciousness—But Don’t Swallow the Poison!
description: So the core mythological structure of yoga is expressed in the myth of the Samudra Mantan. . . . You remember, Ananta the snake is used around Mount Meru, and one side is pulled by the devas, and the other by the asuras, and this battle, this “tug of war” between them ends up churning the ocean…

title: The Magic of Liberation
description: But whose power of love and of creative joy produces a dream-field of harmonious play, and ongoing divine growth, into ever higher levels of wisdom, and of the spontaneous development of the power of magic? It is the magical dimension of the dream-field, that is the specialty of the Sat Yogi….

title: The Origin and Essence of Community
description: If we look back at the history of Kali Yuga society and culture, we discover that every civilization began as a small community.And every small community began as a school: A spiritual wisdom school. And very often the wisdom school would be accompanied by a sister school, which would be a mystery school. And these two often would function together, and sometimes separately….

title: The Entheojective Perspective
description: To be a Sat Yogi is to have made a shift in one’s register of consciousness.One no longer functions from the egocentric level of the consciousness, but from the theocentric. One no longer leads a human life, but a divine life, a Godly life.It is no longer a life of ordinary subjectivity. Nor of mere objectivity. One could say it is a life of “entheojectivity”….

title: The Self is Knowledge
description: The Self is knowledge: Absolute knowledge. And the process of Sat Yoga is simply the transformation of ignorance into knowledge. But the knowledge that is the Self, is not knowledge mediated by language, or concepts, or images, or affects. It is direct knowledge of the Real, and direct knowledge—gyana, gnosis, direct knowledge—is knowledge without ego, a knower, or a known, because knowledge knows that there is no knower—and there is no known…

title: How to Activate Your Mirror Neurons
description: It is this that meditation achieves: the restoration of the true nature of the Self prior to the initial toxic identifications from the family system. And it is this purification of the toxicity of consciousness that then allows the luxury of activating the mirror neurons without danger, without confusion, without empathy becoming another form of oppressive identification…

title: Relative Life & Absolute Life
description: A yogi is one who learns to value life, and who can discern the difference between a relative life and Absolute life. The yogi knows all too well that a relative existence is temporary, short, fleeting. And that its only value lies in manifesting Absolute life. Eternal life. To convert the temporal into the eternal is yoga?

title: The Three Mantras of Sat Yoga
description: The three mantras of Sat Yoga represent symbolically the three principles that must be mastered by consciousness in order to realize its full potential—and to activate all of those powers that are required for the transformation of destiny.So, we can say that the first principle, the Om Namah Shivaya…

title: Realizing the Gift of Consciousness
description: The world is now moving out of a period in which the hegemonic ideology was that of materialism. And because of the advent of quantum physics and other contemporary sciences, it has become clear that it makes more sense to understand the fundamental stuff of the universe is not matter because matter is derivative from quantum wave functions, and they are derivative of a unitive quantum field that is not material, that is recognized by science as that which constitutes consciousness itself…

title: Are You Ready for Real Life?
description: Your nature is freedom that cannot be taken away or lost. The identity of the ego that has lost its freedom, was never you, was never real, was always empty of any inherent existence or essence. It was an appearance but not a reality. The life of the ego is a dream. There is much to be learned from the dream, but the real learning begins at the moment of awakening from the dream.

title: Dropping the Delusion of Me
description: Sat Yoga is the irrevocable gift of the “I”, the “me”, and the “mine”, to the Supreme Absolute Consciousness. Have you given that gift? Until that gift has been given—irrevocably—one cannot be considered a yogi. In exchange for that gift, one receives the Supreme and Absolute Consciousness, in exchange. And one receives freedom from one’s past, from one’s traumas, from one’s limitation, from all of one’s self-images, from all of the patterns of misbehavior, and from all of the forms of suffering that come with the ego-mind..

title: Portal to the Primordial
description: A Sat Yogi is one who abides in Paramdham, the Supreme State, also known as Mukti Dham, the abode of the liberated.\nHave you all found your way to Paramdham? Do you know the way?\nIt is a secret way. But the secret is known to all traditions. But it is known only conceptually. And one cannot get there with concepts.

title: Nirgun & Sagun Brahman
description: The Real, in the Vedic metaphysical system, is called Brahman. Brahman is nondual absolute presence. And yet, if Brahman is nondual, why do they teach that there are two levels of Brahman? They speak of Nirgun Brahman, and Sagun Brahman. How is that possible?

title: Awaken From the Dream of the Universe
description: Your nature is freedom that cannot be taken away or lost. The identity of the ego that has lost its freedom, was never you, was never real, was always empty of any inherent existence or essence. It was an appearance but not a reality. The life of the ego is a dream. There is much to be learned from the dream, but the real learning begins at the moment of awakening from the dream.

title: The Self Pervades All
description: Bhagvan Uvacha. In the Bhagavad Gita, the key sentence is spoken by the Lord God who animates the body of Sri Krishna. And he says, “All beings abide within me. But I do not abide within them.”\nDo you understand the significance of this statement by God?

title: Becoming a Maharishi
description: Sat Yogis are those who have received a great boon. They have received the grace of God because of their surrender to God. And this grace gives them the gift of sight; the gift of being a rishi, or even a Maharishi.\nThe rishi is one who can see the Truth; who can see the One Self, pervading the many; who sees the infinitesimal spiraling out into the infinite, instantaneously, as the emanation of all worlds, all dreams, all manifest forms, and yet remains always invisible, except to the sight of God.

title: The Miracle of Consciousness
description: Consciousness is the great miracle. Most people take the miracle for granted. And most remain at the very surface of consciousness without ever exploring its depths; without ever wondering: “What is consciousness really capable of?”\nWe do not learn to use the gift that we are given. And in the modern age, the intelligence that has been used has focused only on the objective aspect of consciousness: it is focused only on the manipulation of what has been quaintly called “matter”, without fully understanding what it is manipulating, but being able to produce extraordinary gadgets, extraordinary means of communications, extraordinary means of altering the environment, extraordinary means of calculation.

title: False Consciousness: Then and Now
description: In the 19th century, Western civilization discovered that it was living in false consciousness, and we begin to have the appearance of literary stories such as Jekyll and Hyde and The Portrait of Dorian Gray and other literary productions that came out of the Romantic movement that portrayed this split consciousness and came with the recognition that we were not masters over our own motivations, over our own bodies, over our own understanding of reality, and that there were levels of consciousness—that we had no access to—that were running our lives.

title: “El Hombre Propone, Dios Dispone”
description: The old cliché “El hombre propone y Dios dispone” [“Man proposes, God disposes”] is an eternal truth. No matter how much effort we make to achieve anything, especially in the spiritual field, success is owed to the grace of God, not to human effort. And the outcome of whatever we do, no matter how well planned, can never be guaranteed. But only the Will of God will determine the destiny of our actions and our existence..

title: Melting Into the Flame of Being
description: Meditation is when no one does nothing. But to get to the point of realizing you are no one requires absolute focus on the consciousness that is seeking to discover its own essence and discovers only emptiness. But in that discovery, the conditions of existence are altered through the slowing down of metabolic processes and of thought processes that in turn slow down time and enable a deepening of awareness to attain the source of the very will to know the self and to melt back into that original Eternal Self..

title: The Fall of Greatness
description: The time of the ego is over. This is a historic reality. There are no more great egos.Once upon a time in Kali Yuga, the goal of life was to become a great man or a great woman, and there was even a theory that the great man made history. There are no longer great men or great women. There are no longer great artists. There are no longer great thinkers. There are no longer great saints or sages..

title: The Journey Beyond Meaning
description: The Real is blissful because it is formless and other-less and because it is beyond meaning and beyond any sense of “I”, and those are the criteria of purity of consciousness that has been decontaminated of duality. For the ego consciousness—for that very low level of awareness and intelligence that inhabits a phantasmatic realm of multiplicity—there cannot be bliss, but the ego functions in terms of its relationship between jouissance and meaning.

title: Meditation is De-Reification
description: Reification comes from the Latin word res, which means “thing”. The modern age is characterized and often identified with the work of Rene Descartes in the 1600s, who began his meditations with the understanding that the soul, the consciousness, is res cogitans, a thinking thing. As soon as that presupposition was made of being a thing, then there was no way out of the conceptualization of a world of things and of thing-hood as the basic principle of reality.

title: Preparing for the Phase Transition
description: DescriptionTranscriptionDownloads Excerpt: The word “Sandhya” refers to a phase transition. It’s one of the important concepts in yogic psychology, that it’s very important to be in a meditative state during any phase transition, because things are changing at a very rapid rate. Not only in the morning do the bats go to sleep and the […]

title: No Artificial Ingredients
description: A Sat Yogi is consciousness without artificial ingredients. It is the removal of everything artificial within consciousness. That is the work of the sadhana of the Sat Yogi: to realize consciousness as it is in itself, in its purity; consciousness without any imported ingredients or without the belief that there is anywhere from which ingredients could be imported; consciousness independent of thought forms, unattached to thought forms, including thought forms that are projected as external others; and therefore consciousness without longing, without regret, without desire, without lack, but also without lack of lack; consciousness without attribute, without attachment, but also without detachment, because there is nothing to be either attached or detached to or from.

title: The True Practice of Sat Yoga
description: The true practice of Sat Yoga is the cessation of all mental activity while abiding in the highest center of consciousness. It is that cessation, stillness, that removes all interference patterns and all differentiation—between the attention that is abiding, and that power in which the consciousness is enveloped and there is a merging into God Consciousness—that can remain as the Truth of our Being, but can remain so only if there has been achieved prior to that, a complete purification of thought and desire, affect, body, speech and activity; because impurities at any of those levels will draw the attention back into the phenomenal plane, into body consciousness, into the illusion of maya, and any unfinished business, uncompleted, unresolved desires or fears that remain, pull the attention down from the highest center and bring one back into the form of a seeker.

title: The Meaning of the Cross
description: Shunyamurti explains the symbolic meaning of the Cross.

title: The Link Between Sacrifice & Vairagya
description: Shunyamurti speaks about the relationship between sacrifice and vairagya (dispassion).

title: Restoring the Aryastocracy
description: Shunyamurti speaks about the loss of nobility in culture and how we must return to that nobility of spirit.

title: The Final Stages of the Path
description: Shunyamurti gives a detailed explanation of the path from the Trivium to the Quadrivium, explaining all of the steps along the way.

title: You Can’t Fake It If You Want to Make It
description: Shunyamurti talks about the performativity paradox and about how one must do the inner work and move beyond faking spiritual progress.

title: What Myths Are You Living Under?
description: Shunyamurti states that we must return to Truth, that we see through the falsity of the historical and political narratives/myths…

title: The Value of Virtuous Community
description: Shunya describes the gift of living in a community of real yogis, of the way a community should be, of the power of a community, and the gift of living in this (Sat Yoga) community.

title: Language & The Murder of the Self
description: Shunyamurti describes the acquisition of language as the repression of the (Real) Self, describing the process of exclusion involved in language, the first case being the I-thought, about the psychotic delusions involved in language and the ego structured by language, the radical evil that is the mother tongue, and how the only way to help the world is through eliminating the languaged ego because otherwise we are on the side of the Death Drive.

title: The Practice of Radical Freedom
description: Shunyamurti speaks of Sat Yoga as the practice of freedom, of how the teachings are not to be taken as belief but to as tools to achieving freedom, and how it is useful to seek the help of an expert who can help you achieve that freedom, and speaks in very general terms about the complication of the spiritual path/journey to freedom that is created by the unconscious.

title: Realize That Liberation is a Choice
description: Shunyamurti speaks about turning desire into discernment which opens the capacity to make the choice of Liberation.

title: The 7 Levels of the Abyss
description: It takes great courage to go through the abyss and once you begin the journey you realize that there isn’t just one abyss, turns out there are 7 abysses…

title: Meditation: From Involution to Transvolution
description: Shunyamurti reveals that meditation is the act of going from involution to transvolution, which is against the logic of nature/the natural world (in alchemy, “opus contra naturam”) which works in evolution and devolution, against the illusion of a natural being/world, but recognizing God as Absolute Nothingness and surrendering to that Nothingness.

title: The Failing System in a Nutshell
description: Shunyamurti speaks about the view of enlightenment in both the East and West, as well as how this has morphed through time.

title: The Absolute Cookie Dough
description: Shunyamurti uses the example of cookie dough to explain the essential goodness of being, that we need no external validation, and that we must return to that essence and not identify with the ego that cannot taste its own sweetness.

title: The Divine Process of Yoga
description: Shunyamurti describes the process of yoga and its correlates with the Christian tradition of baptism, the Eucharist, and confession.

title: The Spiritual Origin of Theater
description: Shunyamurti describes the role of theater in culture, its connection to theory, to the invisible, to Truth and beauty.

title: The Ecosystem of Eternity
description: Shunyamurti speaks of the development of discernment and an unspoken recognition that leads one to a spiritual life and a communal life.

title: Music: The Feminine Logic of Love
description: Shunyamurti speaks about mathematics, Pythagoras, and about how music represents the qualitative, Divine Feminine side of mathematics.

title: How Fascinating is Fascination!
description: Shunyamurti speaks about the topic of fascination and its psycho-spiritual implications.

title: Sat Yoga: The Science of Joy
description: Excerpt: ”Sat Yoga is a science – it’s the most ancient science in the history of humanity; it’s the science of consciousness. . . . The science that seeks to understand: what is the true extent of the human potential? How far can we grow beyond the normal ego-consciousness that limits our lives to a melodrama of suffering . . . is there a way to grow beyond the traumas that have limited our scope, our ability to even understand the mind of God?”

title: Gratitude is a Bond of Love
description: Shunyamurti speaks about and describes three different levels of gratitude that come out of the three different registers of consciousness.

title: How to Understand True Will
description: Student Question: What is true will?

title: Is Sat Yoga For You? – Dare the Impossible
description: Shunyamurti describes what Sat Yoga is interested in to help visitors decide if it is right for them and then describes the goals of the Sat Yoga Institute: to help one think the unthinkable, to bear the unbearable, and to dare the impossible, delving into each of these topics.

title: Consecrating the Inner Temple
description: Shunyamurti describes consecration (making consciousness a sacred space) as the essence of healing…

title: Receiving the Christmas Gift
description: Excerpt: Shunyamurti explores our symbolic meanings of Christmas, why we celebrate and what is it really for?

This day has great symbolic significance. The number 12 signifies completion, wholeness, and fulfillment of one’s Godly mission. One can think of such examples as the twelve months of the year and the twelve houses of the zodiac, the twelve tribes of Israel, the twelve labors of Hercules. This number is occurring now in such an intensified form (on 12/12/12) because it is the time of completion on three different levels: the planetary level, the individual egoic level, and the spiritual level, the latter meaning the relationship of the soul to God.

title: Allowing the Power of Love to Flow
description: “Sat Yoga is a finishing school – probably the last of the finishing schools.  Feminism killed off most of them, but here we have a co-ed finishing school… and yes we are here to finish off the ego but we are doing it not by destruction but by allowing it to attain its perfect form and then the ego blossoms into the soul and if we allow it the soul blossoms into pure spirit.

title: The Solid Abyss of Triumph
description: “You know ‘SAT’ is an acronym. Did anybody know that? Do you know what ‘SAT’ stand for? Anyone know? It means: the Solid Abyss of Triumph. Triumph is the keyword; you will hear the word triumph often is the chants that Anuttara performs. In Sanskrit the word is ‘Jai’ and you hear songs that have the words ‘Jai Sita Ram’ and ‘Govinda Jaya Jaya.’ ‘Jai’ means victory or triumph, but what are we victorious over? It’s the triumph over maya, over the delusion of the ego that creates negativity, self-doubt, despair, depression, anxiety, envy, all the agonies of the ego that we all know so well they don’t need to be listed. So all of these need to be triumphed over, but how do we triumph over them? First we have to become solid…”

title: Compassion: Only after Dispassion
description: “Our natural state is pure awareness and absolute purity of mind and heart, and thus a state of love-filled joy. But we are only in that state if we are in the Real Self. And the problem for human consciousness is that a false self has intervened to disconnect our consciousness from the Real Self. And so we must learn to recognize the Real Self. And it’s easy to do because the Real Self differs from the false self in one essential way; the Real Self is non-arising. Any self that arises as an object, as a sense of being a body in the world, as having emotions, intentions, agendas, and relations in duality with others, is the false self. The Real Self is non-arising, and from the perspective from the false self, then, the Real Self does not exist because it doesn’t arise, it’s unborn, it’s unmanifest. But what the Real Self knows is that it’s that which arises that does not really exist; it’s not real because it’s fleeting, it’s impermanent, it’s in constant change, and it’s constantly fragmented, different emotions, different attitudes, different thoughts, contradictory, conflicting, feeling, and cognition states; whereas the Real Self that’s non-arising is eternal, unchanging, immutable — untouched by the chaos of the false self.”

title: Avoidance Or a Void Dance
description: We meditate in order to come out of avoidance. Because the ego is an avoidance, it is in avoidance and it is an avoidance of the Real…

title: May The Real Seva Begin
description: You could say we are like candles. The body is the wax, the mind is the wick, but until the wick is lit by the Flame of Shiva, the candle cannot do its service, and our service is to remain always lit up by that Flame. Never let that light go out. That light will itself dissolve the ego and its sufferings, and its narcissism and its lack of understanding of the Real, and the flame itself will do the work, the flame itself will inspire the thoughts in the mind that will come as gifts to oneself and the world, the flame itself will give the power for the physical labor, the flame itself will create the love and the unity. So trust in Shiva, keep the Flame lit, don’t make it something theoretical, but always be in the state of Karma Yoga.

title: Seva on God’s Relation-Ship
description: Seva can be considered an acronym, a Signifier of the Eternal Values of the Absolute. But then if you ask, what is that eternal value that is most significant? You get another acronym. Silence of the Ego equals Victory of the Absolute. That is our Seva. If you think about all the myths, both east and west, about the history of humanity, they are all about a fall. Whether a fall from Sat Yuga to Kali Yuga or a fall from Garden of Eden to a fallen state of history, it is all about that…

title: The Wholly Spectrum of Seva
description: Underneath the heading of Seva, many aspects of what service really is can be enumerated that we haven’t yet covered in this retreat. One is that service involves a life of simplicity. We serve through being simple, through living simply without unnecessary and ostentatious accumulations of things, we live with the accurate necessity that diminishes our footprint on this planet to the minimal so that all can survive in the best way possible. The more simply we can each live here at Arunachala, the more yogis can live here at Arunachala and be fed and housed etc. But simplicity has a purifying dimension to it, regardless to your way of life or where you live…

title: Through Thought
description: We come together but we come together to be alone, in the innermost core of our Being. In most other social organizations whether it’s society or subculture out there or most families, people are together in order to be enmeshed and to be full of noise and conflict and projection and alienation from the Self. Here we come together to return to the Self. To stop running, to stop blaming, to stop projecting, and to stop identifying with the people in our lives, because when we join an ashram we come to recognize that this world of bodies is the illusion…

title: Seva Saves!
description: This retreat will be one in which we will be discussing a subject that goes to the heart of the yogic life, a life of Seva. It is a fact that Seva Saves, but we have to know what we mean by Seva and we have to know what we mean by being saved. Because Seva is not simply work, it’s not about being a workaholic, that is not service and in fact those who have workaholic tendencies, their service is to do nothing. There has to be a balance, because often if you are a workaholic means you are running away from yourself. Rather than serving God, you are running away from God… under the guise of serving God, and it’s important that we don’t do that. The action must be balanced with the meditation. (Event: Seva Saves! Retreat.

title: No “Other” Community
description: Someone asked during the retreat about hypnosis. The ego is a state of hypnosis, a self-reinforcing hypnosis through the suggestions that the ego is constantly filling your mind with. That is why we say, at the end of every meditation, the words Aum, Shanti, Shanti, Shanti. The word Shanti means both peace and silence and it is said three times because the triple silence is necessary to shift the energy field. The triple silence… of outer silence, no intention of speaking to an other, the silence of the mind, in which there is no inner speaking between fragments of the ego or superego, and the Ultimate Supreme Silence of the Presence of the Supreme Self. It is when all those three levels are in alignment that the energy field shifts.

title: Be One World
description: We have learned that the split of the mind was caused by language, the identification with words, with thoughts. It is language that created the split between the illusion of an inside world and an outside world. There is no such thing, there is only one world. There really is no experience and imperience, it only seems that way because language makes it so, and we buy into the illusion of thoughts as if they were real, when they are utterly unreal. It is language that has split the Self from God, has split humanity from Nature, has split each of us from each other, has created all the conflict and the wars and competitions, and the desire to create bigger and bigger weapons to defend this imaginary being against that imaginary being, and in the process devastating what is real. (Event: Divine Love is Real Retreat)

title: The Yoga of Love
description: We teach how out of the original Sat Yoga emerged the seven principal yogas. But those yogas do not include bhakti yoga. But it must remain absent, because it is the secret yoga. It is the yoga of Love. And bhakti yoga must never become a separate yoga, because it is non-separation. As soon as it becomes some separate specialized form, it becomes reduced to rituals and ceremonies and mantras and chanting and holding hands and hugging and that sort of thing, and the real meaning of the yoga of Love is lost. The yoga of Love is the true esoteric yoga, the most esoteric of all. Without the yoga of Love, there is no raja yoga, it is an empty, futile, boring exercise in concentration, it is praja yoga, not raja yoga. Raja is the king, praja is the subject. We don’t want to do the yoga of subjects, begging for crumbs from the king. This is a kingdom of Love. (Event: Divine Love is Real Retreat)

title: An Intense Love Affair
description: Where is the secret key to reaching Liberation? The key is not secret, but then again it really is secret. It is well known… as a signifier. How to silence the mind is really the question isn’t it? The very simple answer is: it is Love that does that. Love is all you need in this song, but it must be real Love and it must be Love for God. No other Love will liberate you. In fact, the other kinds of love will enslave you and devastate you. But do we love God? For most people the idea of God is too abstract to love. Not for those who inquire very deeply and recognize that God is within, but even for many of those the power of God is too great. (Event: Divine Love is Real Retreat)

title: Beyond Identifications
description: Silence doesn’t really have a charge, in fact it is the absence of all charge. It begins usually with serenity, and that deepens into a very deep sense of peace and well-being; then, happiness emerges from that and blossoms into joy. The heart opens to that joy and then the flow of Divine Love emerges until there is the overflow into bliss. So we have to sit long enough to allow the full experience, full realization and stabilize in it, and not have even the trace of an “I-thought” thinking this is happening to me, but complete silence, so that you are it. If there is still an “I-thought” that is containing it, or judging it, or evaluating it, it will hold down the experience to a shallow level. So there has to be a complete surrender and melting into it, and then there indeed is a charge, very powerful. (Event: Divine Love is Real Retreat)

title: A Love Allergy
description: Many people have an allergy to the word love, with good reason. So we made the title of the retreat “Divine Love,” not human love, and we have to be very clear of the difference, because the human ego cannot love.

title: The Four Pillars of Yoga
description: “The traditional yogic texts say that a yogic life is built on four pillars, and attending Satsang is one of those. The other three are: simplicity, leading a simple life without excess, without ostentation, without wastage. . . . truthfulness, a yogi is dedicated to being truthful—and more than just truthful in a factual sense, but leading an authentic life. . . . the third one is seva, or service, to lead a life that’s not based on getting as much as you can for yourself, but of giving as much as you can to the world. . . . Now, a Satsang, for those of you who haven’t been to one, the word “Sat” you’ll notice appears a lot in our discourse here, Sat refers to the Supreme Beingness, the truth of what we are when we take away all of the falseness and the mediated and artificial aspects of our self, when we get down to what is natural and eternal in ourselves. And yoga means “yoke,” union. . . . You know we tend to think that that it’s only people out there who sabotage our happiness, but it’s actually we who are responsible for that; we set that up. And once we assume our own responsibility for our happiness, then life begins to get a lot better. . . . And gradually our intellect, our buddhi, becomes clearer and clearer, and we begin to realize the ways that we’d been sabotaging ourselves on subtler and subtler levels until we get to the root of the phantasies that have been motivating us to deny ourselves or to cheat ourselves of our own bliss . . .”

title: The Pillars of Protection
description: There are four pillars that protect our meditative practice. You can think of them as holding up the inner temple. The two outer pillars are gyana and dharma. Gyana is understood as having two levels, the lower gyana and the higher gyana. In this case, the outer pillar is the lower gyana, which is the conceptual understanding of non-duality, of your absolute oneness with God; that yourself is the One Self. That absolute understanding of that and the capacity to affirm that in your mind when maya begins to attack is the first protection.

title: On the Brink of Reality
description: “In Christianity there is a trinity as we all know: the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit. This trinity is an archetype and exists in every religion, every spiritual path, although it has different names in different paths. . . . In the yogic path, it’s only one of a number of trinities, however; we could call it the “vertical trinity.” And the equivalent in the yogic tradition is noted by the words “Sat, Chit, and Ananda.”  . . . But there is also a horizontal trinity that is often noted by the names of three gods:” Brahma, Vishnu, and Shankara.” . . . They refer to creation, sustenance, and destruction, if you will—or transformation. But you can think of it as kind of a black board, or a white board, which is the Absolute; we could say that’s Shiva. And then on that someone writes with a pen a sentence that is a narrative, an ego narrative: the story of a civilization, the story of a culture—or the story of your own life. And then once that’s written, Vishnu repeats it over and over again; it becomes a pattern that gets sustained in one’s life. Not only sustained, but if the pattern is pathological, then stained: one’s life becomes stained by a pattern that repeats automatically, over and over again. How many of you have had the experience of making the same mistake over and over again in your life?”

title: Understanding the Trinity
description: “We can see the Christian Trinity in many ways in both the Ramayana and the Mahabharata. . . . In the Ramayana, it is Rama, God the Father, and Sita, who is the soul/the Holy Spirit, who goes into exile at some point, captured by the demonic forces. And then you have the Son, Hanuman, who is a monkey god. Very odd, why would they choose a monkey god to represent the Son? And it’s because the human being in the state of ego-consciousness is a monkey: its monkey mind is always chattering, its interests are mainly in food and sex, and it is wild and will not come under discipline. So the monkey is a wonderful metaphor. And yet this monkey, Hanuman, becomes divine. . . . It is said that God stands for G.O.D.: Generation, Operation, Destruction. . . . And we are now at a point where our current world cannot be sustained any longer because of the lack of love.”

title: Yoga: The Science of Consciousness
description: Shunyamurti speaks about yoga – the science of consciousness

title: Archetypes
description: Shunyamurti explains what archetypes are.

title: Inside the Temple
description: “You are all sacred beings. There are profane beings and there are sacred beings. The word ‘profane,’ comes from pro fana—before the temple; its those who stand outside the temple. And then those who enter the temple, become sacred beings.” And only by entering the ‘holiest of holies,’ the most sacred temple, the realm of the Real Self, may we complete our inward journey. “We are in the temple because we know that the only way out of the suffering of the profane world is to enter into the sacred dimension of our being.”

title: Love & Wisdom
description: “Love without wisdom is inadequate. The road to hell is paved with good intentions.” But, “Equally, wisdom without love is absolutely futile, and we know so many philosophers who have a great . . . capacity to think, but they cant love their way out of a paper bag. And thinking alone wont get you out of the box of the ego; the two must be integrated.” Likewise, there are also two manifestations of love in action. Karma yoga is the essence of love in action, “to act without greed, possessiveness, the desire for some ulterior agenda to be fulfilled by the ego, then that will be able to unravel the egos knots and unwillingness to love. The second one is community because its not just a matter of ‘What do I do,’ but the real test is can I help form a communion of love with other human beings?cause that’s the ultimate test isn’t it? Can we live together in love?”

title: A Sovereignty of Being
description: “An ability to remain unshakable when things happen that create anxiety and fear and confusion in others, we can remain a pillar of strength. And that is more…”

title: The Triple Act of Being
description: “Sat Yoga is the process of becoming fully aware of . . . [your] radiance. And then merging into that radiance and realizing the unlimited scope of that radiance,” Sat Yoga meditation is a triple act: an unrestricted act of understanding, an unconditional act of love, and an undefinible act of Being.

title: A Complete Surrender
description: Shunyamurti explores the role of surrender in a world of illusion

title: A Place of Refuge
description: Coming together in a Satsang, or spiritual gathering, “creates a womb of love in which to bathe, in which to let go of the stresses that we have to deal with ‘out there’ in that world of non-love, of competition and anger and brutality. And the more we create a close-knit community of love, the more this becomes a refuge. And that’s what is important to the soul of each of us; we need a refuge. Everyone needs a place to be able to come and know that they’re accepted without judgment. Where they can sit and let go of everything.”

title: Private Property vs. the Commonwealth
description: “The very idea of private property is a fairly recent one.” At one time, whether it was Native American tribes or even the commonwealths of England, property was distributed amongst the people. But, as Shunyamurti, the director of the Sat Yoga Institute, reminds us, “Now we have a situation where one percent of the population owns about 90 percent of the property of the world, and everyone is deprived of it. And this is why you have revolutions and terrorism and all of that. There is a basic unfairness in the way that the goods of the universe are distributed today because of greed; it has absolutely corrupted the minds of people.”

title: Spiritually Giving Birth
description: Namaste. The good news, the eternally good news is that, God, the Supreme Being, the Intelligence that is the creative power…

title: Exercise: A Being of Light
description: Spiritual wisdom exercise teaching offered by Shunyamurti, director of the Sat Yoga Institute in Costa Rica.

title: Divestiture
description: “And so you have to ask yourself, do you want that freedom or not, you may not [Shunyamurti is referring to the freedom of Self-Realization]. But, it is the…”

title: Reverie or Evacuation
description: Spiritual wisdom teaching offered by Shunyamurti, director of the Sat Yoga Institute in Costa Rica.

title: The Impossibility of Ego Love
description: For the moth to actually dive into the flame and dissolve it is the end of the moth, so most moths circle around it, they get burned a little bit but then…
